intro: Saxifraga megacordia, commonly known as the giant saxifrage, is a striking alpine plant native to the high elevations of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its large, fleshy, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 20 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
